title: Ivory Coast vs Senegal abandoned after supporter RUGBY TACKLES player during pitch invasion
text:
Sport Ivory Coast vs Senegal abandoned after supporter RUGBY TACKLES player during pitch invasion Premier League stars Sadio Mane, Eric Bailly, Wilfried Zaha and Idrissa Gueye were all playing in the match Share A pitch invader tackles Lamine Gassama of Senegal during Ivory Coast vs Senegal (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Ivory Coast's friendly with Senegal was abandoned on Monday night after a mass pitch invasion in which a player was tackled to the ground. 
The match was in its closing stages when trouble began in the stands of the Charlety Stadium on the outskirts of Paris. 
A minority of supporters evaded stewards to gain access to the pitch and one appeared to rugby tackle Senegal's Lamine Gassama. 
Minutes earlier a group of fans were photographed appearing to somehow evade barriers and climb into the arena without tickets. 
French referee Tony Chapron ordered the players back to the changing rooms before cancelling the game in the 88th minute. The referee abandoned the match after 88 minutes (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Supporters ran onto the pitch in the closing stages (Photo: Icon Sport/Getty) Sadio Mane had earlier scored in the match for Senegal (Photo: Icon Sport/ Getty) 
The game was level at 1-1 at the time, with Liverpool forward Sadio Mane scoring the goal for Senegal from the penalty spot. 
Premier League stars Eric Bailly, Wilfried Zaha and Idrissa Gueye were also playing in the match. Pitch invaders are tackled by security (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Fans invade the pitch (Photo: Icon Sport/Getty) Fans invade the pitch (Photo: Icon Sport/ Getty) Read More Tragedy at Brazilian football match as supporter plunges to his death before Sao Paulo vs Corinthians 
It's not the first time that a match between the two countries has been abandoned. 
Senegal were disqualified from the 2013 Africa Cup of Nations after missiles were thrown onto the pitch by supporters during their play-off match against Ivory Coast in 2012. Like us on Facebook
